subject: History
title: The Pax Mongolica
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Pax Mongolica usable.

hook.text: The Mongol Empire was built on bloodâ€”but once established, it created history's longest peace corridor.

buildup.text: The Pax Mongolica (1250â€“1350) made the Silk Road safe. A woman could walk alone with gold from China to Hungary.

discovery.text: Marco Polo traveled to Kublai Khan's court. His account introduced Europe to Chinese paper money and coal.

twist.text: This peace also let the Black Death travel freely. The same roads that carried silk carried plague.

climax.text: For a century, the Mongol Empire was the world's postal service, trade network, and police force.

punchline.text: The greatest peace was enforced by the fiercest warriors.

quiz.question: What negative consequence came from the Pax Mongolica's open trade routes?
options: The Black Death spread along the same safe roads
Cultural traditions were erased by forced assimilation
